content.description: Climb directly to the left of Huck a Turbo. Climb awesome chicken heads to a small horizontal crack. slot that cam! pull onto the slab and inch your way to a bolt that seems impossibly far away. figure out how to get to the next bolt and then to the chains...its hard. Hint: depump after the chicken heads...
content.protection: 5 bolts and a blue Metolius cam, or gear in the .25-.3 inch range. New anchor. 2 SS bolts with a nice big rap ring, no more tat necessary.
content.location: first bolted line as you walk onto the ledge

content.description: Climb the massive nobs and chickenheads to the right if Huck a Turbo. Trend left to the third bolt with some small gear to supplement then back right to the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to .5 optional, 2 bolt anchor
content.location: The 4th route to the left once on the ledge.

content.description: Start next to the roof at the end of the grass ledge. Climb fun nobs and chicken heads, moving left after the second bolt. Gear eliminates the runout to the third bolt.
content.location: The last route as you move right on the grass ledge.

content.description: sustained, vertical climbing on big chickenheads.
content.protection: 6 bolts, (Optional Green Alien ~ BD .4)2 bolt Anchor w/ chain & rings
content.location: Bolted line to the right of Huck a Turbo. Start on a "crescent moon" series of chickenheads. Follow bolts up to a horizontal-ish crack. Climb directly up from here. Follow two more protection bolts to the anchor.

content.description: Climb the chickenheads past three bolts to a ledge, then head a few feet to the right for some features and small cracks that lead you to the anchors up and left. Anything but a great belay and you'll hit the ground between each bolt.
content.protection: Three bolts off the start, then a handful of small aliens will get you to the top.   Two bolt anchor.
content.location: Head up onto the ledge at the base of all the routes, and find a single bolt in the middle of a well-defined solid black water streak.  To get down, rappel the route.

content.description: Boldery start past a fix pin leads to a thin finger crack that goes to good hand size finish.
content.protection: Small nuts to hand size cams.
content.location: Left center of wall, the obvious crack.

content.description: Hard start leads to fun chicken head climbing and a sloppy top out!
content.location: start on a good looking flake, follow bolts straight up. Same anchor as Last Time to Selma

content.description: This wall is covered in an amazing frenzy of chickenheads which provide the spice to flavor its slightly overhung and otherwise featureless face.  Routes are moderate to hard here, but very sweet.
